content:
Is there a module (or way of configuring core's functionality) that let's you display a menu that 'follows' you through the hierarchy? As an example, consider the following menu:

Level 1-A
- Level 2-A
- Level 2-B
  - Level 3-A
  - Level 3-B
- Level 2-C
Level 1-B
Level 1-C

Initially only Level 1-* links are displayed. When you click Level 1-A then you see only the Level 2-* links. When you click Level 2-B then you see only Level 3-A and Level 3-B.
In other words, all links at or above the current one are hidden.
I don't know the answer, but for curiosity: How do you go back to a higher level when these links aren't displayed?
Breadcrumbs, back button, etc. Same as any other link on a website.

I see! On Drupal Answers someone says, the Menu Block module provides some options to achieve it. I guess that part of Menu Block didn't make it in Backdrop, might give an idea for a separate module, though.

Three level menu: How to show only the children of the current page?
A three level menu: Item 1 Item A Item X Item Y Item Z Item B Item Xx Item Yx Item Zx Item C Item Xy When viewing the "Item 1...

@BWPanda if I get your question right, you're searching for something that the D7 menu_block module provided: "Make the starting level follow the active menu item." I'm not aware of a module, that provides this for Backdrop yet.
Thanks @Olaf Grabienski! I knew I had seen a "Make the starting level follow the active menu item" option somewhere before. Seems it was in that D7 module.
The module you are looking for @BWPanda is most likely https://www.drupal.org/project/hierarchical_select
...not sure if there was an equivalent for menus.

@klonos Thanks, but @Olaf Grabienski and @indigoxela were right that it was Menu Block, of which Backdrop has a (hidden) port: https://github.com/docwilmot/menu_block

docwilmot/menu_block
Contribute to docwilmot/menu_block development by creating an account on GitHub.
...wasn't that functionality included in core though?
...OK, only the "Maximum depth" feature seems to have been merged into core ...what you are after is the "Make the starting level follow the active menu item" feature I guess.
Yes, that part wasn't included. At some point I thought I needed to port it but then realized I didn't need it
